meanings.definition: Having a resemblance or similarity to something else.
meanings.sent1: The two houses on the street were simulars in color and size.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a simulars painting to the original masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The simulars outfits worn by the twins made everyone do a double-take.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so simulars to her mother's that it was almost indistinguishable.
meanings.sent5: The simulars patterns on the wallpaper and carpet created a harmonious look in the room.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is similar to another.
meanings.sent1: The new student was a simulars to the class president in many ways.
meanings.sent2: The robot was designed to be a simulars to a human in its movements.
meanings.sent3: The two cars parked side by side looked like simulars in the parking lot.
meanings.sent4: The young artist was considered a simulars to the famous painter in his style.
meanings.sent5: The flower was a simulars to a daisy, but with a unique color pattern.
